updated_cases.title: Takes 100% samples of Backend RTT at NSproxy with same type of apps and on same tenant
updated_cases.custom_summary: Send Specific Traffic type by a nsclient via nsproxy and make sure they are all collected by the collector
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Send specific traffic type by a tenant client with same type of app via NSproxy
2. Collect the traffic by our collector
3. Make sure the total number of the traffic we collected is correct
updated_cases.custom_expected: The total number of the traffic we collected is correct

updated_cases.title: Takes 100% samples of Backend RTT at NSproxy with different type of apps on same tenant
updated_cases.custom_summary: Send Different Real Traffics type by a nsclient via nsproxy and make sure they are all collected by the collector
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Send different type of traffic by a nsclient via NSproxy
2. Collect the traffic by the collector
3. Make sure the number of each traffic we collected is correct
updated_cases.custom_expected: The total number of each traffic type we collected is correct

updated_cases.title: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with IPsec
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with IPsec
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set feature flag to disabled. The lookup will be skip.
2. Set steering configuration as traffic type: cloud APPs only (On-prem)
3. Set a source location bypassed in exception for on-prem
4. Not set the same source location bypassed in exception for off-prem (all web traffic)
5. Send traffic from that specific source location through IPsec
6. Check log. The traffic should NOT be bypassed. Since the Lookup will be skip

updated_cases.title: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with CEP
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with CEP
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set feature flag to disabled. The lookup will be skip.
2. Set steering configuration as traffic type: cloud APPs only (On-prem)

updated_cases.title: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with multiple steering configurations
updated_cases.custom_summary: Verify whether traffic will be bypassed with multiple steering configurations
updated_cases.custom_steps:
1. Set feature flag to disabled. The lookup will be skip.
2. Set A steering configuration as traffic type: cloud APPs only (On-prem)
3. Set B steering configuration as traffic type: all web traffic (On-prem)
3. Set a source location bypassed in exception with B steering configuration
4. Not set the same source location bypassed in exception for Off-prem (all web traffic)
5. Send traffic from that specific source location
6. Check log. The traffic should NOT be bypassed. Since the Lookup will be skip

2. Set A steering configuration as traffic type: cloud APPs only (On-prem) for A OU
3. Set B steering configuration as traffic type: all web traffic (On-prem) for B OU
3. Set a source location bypassed in exception with B steering configuration
4. Not set the same source location bypassed in exception for Off-prem (all web traffic)
5. Send traffic from that specific source location
6. Check log. The traffic should NOT be bypassed. Since the Lookup will be skip
